unnormalised: Reliance Jio added 3.2 million subscribers in the month of July, according to TRAI data. Airtel lagged behind, adding only 1.5 mn. Vodafone Idea (Vi) continued its losing streak, shedding another 1.7 million users. This comes amidst aggressive 5G rollout plans by Jio in major cities like Delhi, Mumbai & Kolkata.
normalised: Reliance Jio added three point two million subscribers in the month of July, according to T-R-A-I data. Airtel lagged behind, adding only one point five million. Vodafone Idea (V-i) continued its losing streak, shedding another one point seven million users. This comes amidst aggressive 5-G rollout plans by Jio in major cities like Delhi, Mumbai and Kolkata.

unnormalised: The increase in Jio's subscriber base is likely fueled by its competitive data plans & affordable JioPhone offers. With data usage soaring, particularly for streaming services and online gaming, access to reliable 4G and 5G networks is crucial. Users are upgrading to faster speeds and bigger data packages, driving the competition. Many youngsters are getting 1.5 GB/day packs.

unnormalised: Vi is struggling to keep up, facing financial constraints and delayed 5G deployment. Analysts predict that Vi needs to raise fresh capital soon to remain competitive in the long run. Their average revenue per user (ARPU) is also lower compared to Jio and Airtel. The govt. should help them out, no?

unnormalised: The continued consolidation in the telecom sector is expected to lead to higher tariffs in the future. While consumers are currently benefiting from low data prices, this may not be sustainable in the long run. Expect to pay more than Rs. 300 for your monthly plan soon.
